faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-EU and EU citizens can purchase Spanish property without citizenship restrictions. The process requires a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), legal representation, and completion of standard conveyancing procedures. Most international buyers work with English-speaking solicitors specializing in foreign property acquisition, simplifying the legal process considerably.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca consistently ranks among Europe's best property markets for families and investors. Affordability combined with lifestyle benefits, established expat communities, excellent healthcare, quality schools, and beach proximity make it exceptionally attractive. The region experiences steady 8% annual appreciation, supporting both lifestyle and investment objectives.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Total acquisition costs typically range from 10-13% of purchase price, including: Property Transfer Tax (6-10% depending on region), legal fees (€1,000-2,500), notary fees (€600-1,200), and registration costs (€300-600). Professional advisors help minimize costs through strategic structuring. Budgeting €50,000 additional to €439,900 purchase price is prudent.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages through Spanish banks and international lenders. Requirements typically include: NIE (tax identification), employment verification, income documentation, and substantial deposit (25-40% common). UK and Northern European citizens often qualify for favorable terms. Professional mortgage brokers specializing in foreign buyers streamline the process significantly.

faqs.question: Hoeveel bedraagt de onroerende voorheffing in Spanje?
faqs.answer: De jaarlijkse onroerende voorheffing (IBI) average 0.4-0.6% of cadastral value (typically 50-70% of market value), costing approximately €800-1,200 annually for this property. Annual wealth tax applies to properties above €600,000 value (not applicable here). Non-resident property owners pay non-resident income tax on rental earnings. Spanish tax advisors help optimize tax positions legally.
